Function Documentation

void CmdNotImplemented (  ) 

this function is called when a command is not found

void execUCTCmd ( char *  cmd,
char *  parameters 
)

execUctCmd : search for the command in the UCT and then executes it by calling the function that performs the command action; for exemple with the command help we call the function listCmd() witch will list all the commands

void initUCT (  ) 

initialize the UCT (user command table), be sure that all the commands in the UCT table are sorted by alphabetic order.

void listUCTCmd (  ) 

char* readline (  ) 

read a line of text that ends with <ENTER>; the final '
' is not added to the result text, but NULL ('') caracter is added this function is a non secured, it can cause an overflow
